Element¶

Element represents a individual block. It can hold a widget and handle operations with it. While setting and removing, a child_dict named dictionary is taken and returned. A valid child_dict is of the following structure.

```child_dict = {

“child”: <Gtk.Widget>, “child_name”: <str>, “icon”: <Gtk.Image>, “header_child”: <Gtk.Widget or None>, “provider”: <Quanta.Provider> }

``` Here the optional key is only header_child. If it is None, it is not used. Other keys are compulsory and their absence raises a KeyError.

class Quanta.Element.Element(child_dict=None, use_action_button=True, pack_type=<enum GTK_PACK_START of type Gtk.PackType>, **kwargs)¶
clear_child()¶

Clears the child at self. After clearing, child-cleared signal is emitted.

get_child()¶

Gets the child held by self.

Returns

The child of self`or None if `self has no child.

Return type

Gtk.Widget

get_child_name()¶

Gets the name of child held by self.

Returns

The child name of self or None if self has no child.

Return type

str

get_header_child()¶

Gets the child packed at the header of self.

Returns

The header child of self or None if self has no header child.

Return type

Gtk.Widget

get_icon()¶

Gets the icon representing child held by self.

Returns

The icon of action_button or None if self has no icon for child..

Return type

Gtk.Image

get_props()¶

Gets the properties of child held by self.

Returns

The dictionary that can be later used to build the same interface.

Return type

dict

get_provider()¶

Gets the provider for child held by self.

Returns

The provider of self or None if self has no child.

Return type

Quanta.Provider

remove_child()¶

Removes the child held by self.

Raises

ValueError – Raised when self has no child.

Returns

A dictionary with child properties.

Return type

dict

Note

By removing a child, all its associated properties like icon, header child are also removed. A child-removed signal is emitted by self after removal.

set_child(child_dict)¶

Sets the child in self from given properties.

Parameters

child_dict (dict) – A valid dictionary with properties of child.

Note

If self already has a child, then its cleared before adding this new child. A child-added signal is emitted after addition.

set_child_name(child_name)¶

Sets the name of child held by self.

Parameters

child_name (str) – The new name of child.

set_from_props(props)¶

Sets the interface of self from given properties.

Parameters

props (dict) – The dictionary from which properties are set.

Note

If self already has a child, then its cleared before adding this new child.

set_header_child(header_child)¶

Sets the header child of self.

Parameters

header_child (Gtk.Widget) – The new header child of self.

Note

Using this method when self already has a header child leads to unexpected results.

set_icon(icon)¶

Sets the icon of child held by self.

Parameters

icon (Gtk.Image) – The new icon of child.

set_provider(provider)¶

Sets the provider of child held by self.

Parameters

provider (Quanta.Provider) – The new provider of child.
